name: serviceably
content:

in a way that is suitable for use or good enough for what is needed: He performed serviceably in school but dropped out at the first opportunity. This serviceably written biography is a welcome addition to the scholarship devoted to the 19th-century statesman.
More examplesFewer examplesHe played the guitar and sang serviceably. Once he proved that he could play the trombone serviceably, he was occasionally asked to sit in with the band. This film tells the story serviceably, but it would have been good to see more interviews with survivors of the event.
